skill: Divide whole numbers to get decimal answers
Add mixed numbers with unlike denominators
Subtract mixed numbers with unlike denominators

questions.question: A recipe needs 3/4 cup flour. To make half, how much flour?
Jake ate 2/5 of pizza, Sam ate 1/4. How much together?
Maria has 5/6 gallon juice, drinks 1/3. How much left?
A board is 3/4 meter. Cut into 3 equal pieces. Each piece?
Tom ran 1 1/2 miles, then 2 1/4 miles. Total distance?
A tank is 3/4 full. After using 1/2 tank, how full?
2/3 of 24 students are girls. How many girls?
Amy read 3/5 of 100 pages. How many pages?
A rope is 4 1/2 feet. Cut 1 3/4 feet. How much left?
1/4 of a class is 6 students. How many total?
It takes 2/3 hour to mow a lawn. How long for 3 lawns?

questions.hint: 5 into 8=1 R3, 5 into 34=6 R4, 5 into 45=9. Answer: 169
3 into 5=1 R2, 3 into 20=6 R2, 3 into 24=8. Answer: 168
5 into 7=1 R2, 5 into 26=5 R1, 5 into 15=3. Answer: 153
6 into 9=1 R3, 6 into 38=6 R2, 6 into 24=4. Answer: 164
8 into 58=7 R2, 8 into 23=2 R7, 8 into 72=9. Answer: 729
3 into 7=2 R1, 3 into 15=5, 3 into 2=0 R2, 3 into 24=8. Answer: 2508
4 into 8=2, 4 into 4=1, 4 into 3=0 R3, 4 into 36=9. Answer: 2109
5 into 9=1 R4, 5 into 41=8 R1, 5 into 13=2 R3, 5 into 35=7. Answer: 1827
6 into 45=7 R3, 6 into 33=5 R3, 6 into 36=6. Answer: 756
8 into 63=7 R7, 8 into 78=9 R6, 8 into 64=8. Answer: 798

Point A is at (3, 5). What is the x-coordinate?
questions.hint: In (x, y), x comes first. So x = 3

questions.question: Point B is at (7, 2). What is the y-coordinate?
questions.hint: In (x, y), y comes second. So y = 2

questions.question: Which point is at the origin?
questions.hint: The origin is where x=0 and y=0

questions.question: Point (4, 6): How far right from origin?
Point (5, 3): How far up from origin?
Which point is on the x-axis?
Which point is on the y-axis?
Point C is 6 right and 4 up. Coordinates?
Which is farther right: (8, 2) or (5, 9)?
Which is higher: (3, 7) or (9, 4)?
Point (0, 5) is on which axis?
To plot (4, 7): Start at origin, move how?
questions.hint: x = right/left, y = up/down. (4,7) = right 4, up 7

questions.question: To plot (0, 6): Start at origin, move how?
questions.hint: x=0 means no right/left. Just up 6

questions.question: To plot (5, 0): Start at origin, move how?
questions.hint: y=0 means no up/down. Just right 5

questions.question: Plot (3, 8). Which comes first?
Points forming a line: (1,1), (2,2), (3,3), (4,?)
To plot (2, 9), which axis do you cross first?
questions.hint: Starting at origin, you move right (along x-axis) first

questions.question: (6, 3) is plotted. Move right 2. New point?
questions.hint: Moving right adds to x: 6+2=8, y stays 3

questions.question: (4, 5) is plotted. Move up 3. New point?
questions.hint: Moving up adds to y: 5+3=8, x stays 4

questions.question: Which point is in the first quadrant?
questions.hint: First quadrant: both x and y positive
